abstract: Kenneth D. Moelis, the president of UBS’s investment bank in New York, is threatening to leave the firm, according to people briefed on the matter.
snippet: Kenneth D. Moelis, the president of UBS’s investment bank in New York, is threatening to leave the firm, according to people briefed on the matter.
lead_paragraph: Kenneth D. Moelis, the president of UBS’s investment bank in New York, is threatening to leave the firm, according to people briefed on the matter.

headline.main: Future of UBS Executive Part of Wall Street Chatter
headline.print_headline: Future of UBS Executive Part of Wall Street Chatter

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: As reports surface that Kenneth D. Moelis, the president of UBS‘s investment bank in New York, is threatening to leave the firm, speculation on the whys and wherefores of the situation is increasing.
lead_paragraph: As reports surface that Kenneth D. Moelis, the president of UBS‘s investment bank in New York, is threatening to leave the firm, speculation on the whys and wherefores of the situation is increasing.

headline.main: TXU, EchoStar Deals May Have Role in UBS Turmoil
